009package imagingbook.common.color.colorspace;
010
011import java.awt.color.ColorSpace;
012
013/**
014 * <p>
015 * Implementation of a D50-based XYZ color space, as a substitute for Java's
016 * built-in standard connection space (obtained with
017 * {@code  ColorSpace.getInstance(ColorSpace.CS_CIEXYZ)}), with improved
018 * accuracy. The reference white point of this color space is D50 and any XYZ
019 * coordinate passed to {@link #fromCIEXYZ(float[])} is assumed to be relative
020 * to D50 as well, thus no conversion (color adaptation) is necessary between
021 * XYZ values. See Sec. 14.1.1 of [1] for details.
022 * </p>
023 * <p>
024 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An
025 * Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
026 * </p>
027 * 
028 * @author WB
029 * @version 2022/11/14
030 * @see XYZ65ColorSpace
031 */
032@SuppressWarnings("serial")
033public class XYZ50ColorSpace extends ColorSpace implements DirectD65Conversion {
034        private static sRgbColorSpace srgbCS = sRgbColorSpace.getInstance();
035        
036        private static final XYZ50ColorSpace instance = new XYZ50ColorSpace();
037        
038        public static XYZ50ColorSpace getInstance() {
039                return instance;
040        }
041        
042        private XYZ50ColorSpace() {
043                super(TYPE_XYZ, 3);
044        }
045
046        // -------------------------------------------------
047
048        @Override       // convert (D50-based) thisXyz to sRGB
049        public float[] toRGB(float[] thisXyz) {
050                return srgbCS.fromCIEXYZ(thisXyz);
051        }
052
053        @Override       // convert sRGB to (D50-based) thisXyz
054        public float[] fromRGB(float[] srgb) {
055                float[] thisXyz = srgbCS.toCIEXYZ(srgb);
056                return thisXyz;
057        }
058        
059        // -------------------------------------------------
060
061        @Override
062        public float[] toCIEXYZ(float[] thisXyz) {
063                return thisXyz; // nothing to do since D50-based XYZ already
064        }
065
066        @Override
067        public float[] fromCIEXYZ(float[] xyz50) {
068                return xyz50;           // nothing to do, since D50-based XYZ is what we want
069        }
070        
071}
